isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - DISASSEMBLE - SWIVEL MITER

step1.para: Remove both clamping bars. Lift the miter housing and gasket/shim pack off the bearing cap ( Figure 75).

figure.caption: Figure 75. Lift Miter Housing and Gasket/Shim Pack Off Bearing Cap

note.para: The miter housing to bearing cap position should be marked so that it can be re-installed in its original location. Some steering gear models will have a roll pin through the clamping bar and into the miter housing to index it to its design position. In this case it is important that the clamping bar is re-installed in the same position so that the roll pin can be re-installed.

step1.para: The miter housing can now be serviced. Remove the lube fitting and the relief fitting on the opposite side of the housing (Figure 76).

figure.caption: Figure 76. Remove Lube Fitting and Relief Fitting

step1.para: Turn the input shaft and line up the roll pin with the openings in the miter housing. Use a drift punch and hammer to drive the roll pin out of the miter gear and input shaft. The roll pin must be pushed through the hole in the opposite side of the housing. The miter gear can now be pried off the input shaft and the shaft can be tapped out of the housing and bearing assembly ( Figure 77).

figure.caption: Figure 77. Drive Roll Pin Out of Miter Gear and Input Shaft

step1.para: Lever the oil seal out of the input shaft end of the miter housing ( Figure 78).

figure.caption: Figure 78. Lever Oil Seal Out of Input Shaft End of Miter Housing

step1.para: Use a spanner wrench to turn the bearing retainer out of the miter housing ( Figure 79).

figure.caption: Figure 79. Turn Bearing Retainer Out of Miter Housing

step1.para: The double row bearing can now be drawn or tapped out of the housing for inspection or replacement ( Figure 80).
